fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This bug is being raised based on both past cases we have about the same subject. 
* [CONFCLOUD\-66811: \[Regression\] Google Drive add\-on is not allowing users to view documents after authenticating|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66811]
* [CONFCLOUD\-66551: Google Drive add\-on is not allowing users to view documents after authenticating|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66551]

h3. Environment
 * This seems to happen on new authentications. So revoking authentication from Google's side and then try to reproduce these steps below

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy either a Google Docs/Sheets link
# Either paste the link directly into the page, or insert a macro by typying "/doc" ("{doc" on the old editor).
# Authenticate the session via the add-on

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to view the doc after the authentication.

h3. Actual Results
No doc is displayed, instead a message is displayed as below (no matter how many times you try to authenticate)

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: [Regression II] Google Drive add-on is not allowing users to view documents after authenticating

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
- When you mention a team, it will expand the mention into a link to the team profile page, and then a list of all the users in that team. 

h3. Suggested Solution
-  Show members of the mentioned team only with hover over.
fields.summary: Team mention members are listed when you mention a team

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 18 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

👋  Thank you all for the feedback! My name is Yousef, one of the PMs working in the Atlassian editor team. We value and appreciate your feedback and understand that there are gaps in the experience. When we built the new editor, we knew it would be a long journey to build a better, more robust experience for a larger group of customers.

Today, we know we’re not “done” building, but we still believe that the editor was the right decision and we are generally proud of the overall experience. We’re doing our best to prioritize what to build next so that we can deliver the most value to you, our customers.

*However, we also understand that it’s not fair to keep this issue open for so long without more regular updates from our side.*  We want to apologise for that. We know tables are valuable to our customers and provide a useful way to neatly present complex information. We know custom widths in tables are important to so many of you, *so we are moving that request up in our list of priorities and will expedite the work needed to ship a solution*. Please hang with us as we bring this functionality into the new editor experience for you.  *We will keep you all posted with more regular updates about the progress and change this ticket status accordingly!*

Some of the workarounds that were mentioned in this ticket wouldn’t solve the issue completely (like using layouts “columns” and place tables inside them to make it smaller), but we think it still offers a slightly better experience when you need to make the table smaller & align it in the page “left or right”.

Thanks for all the feedback again and please keep it coming!
Yousef.
{panel}


{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}


h4. Summary
In the new editing improvements, it's possible to display a table at *full width*, *wide* or *center*, but it's not possible to set your own table width. You can change the width of individual columns within the width of the table, but not alter the table width itself.

h4. Suggestion
Provide the ability for users to set their own table widths in the editor.
fields.summary: Set custom widths in tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On a page using fabric editor, in the Page Properties macro, if you insert a table, you cannot edit the contents of the table. You get something like this:
 !Screenshot 2019-09-03 at 15.33.28.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page, add Page Properties macro (/page properties)
 # Insert a table inside the macro
 # Try to click on the table to edit (to type stuff in the table)

h3. Expected Results

Able to update the table

h3. Actual Results

You get a grey frame around the table when clicking it, but you cannot edit it.

h3. Workaround

Use Microsoft Edge instead
fields.summary: Cannot edit Table in Page Properties macro via IE11

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Attachments macro can be configured to filter the list of attachments by labels. When this is configured, uploading attachments by clicking the "browse for files" and "drag and drop" will not apply those labels to the uploaded attachments.

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add an Attachment macro
# Configure the attachment macro to filter the list of attachments by labels
# Upload an attachment through attachment macro by 'drag and drop' or 'browse files'

h3. Expected Results
Uploading attachments by clicking the "Browse for files" or "drag and drop" should apply those labels to the uploaded attachments.

h3. Actual Results
Uploading attachments by clicking the "Browse for files" or "drag and drop" will no apply those labels to the uploaded attachments.

h3. Workaround
- None
fields.summary: Attachments macro doesn't add labels to uploaded attachments

fields.description: Currently the assignee cannot be configured in Jira as a required field. Hence this field does not show up when an issue is created in Confluence. It is also not possible to add a custom field, which is reuqired in Jira, to be shown in the pop-up mask of (Create Jira '/j') in Confluence. This feature is highly appreciated by us. Many thanks.
fields.summary: Enable creation of Jira task in Page Editor with Field Option "Assignee" and Custom Fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Page Properties Report macro, if any field contains a mention, the link to this mention will be broken

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Legacy or new editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a page properties macro
# Add a table to the macro with a field mentioning some user
# add a label and publish the page
# Create another page
# Insert the page properties report macro and point it to the label
# Publish this page and check the mention field

h3. Expected Results
The mention should link to the user's profile:
{code:none}https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/people/<USER_ID>{code}

h3. Actual Results
It breaks the link in the following way:
{code:none}https://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wikihttps://<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/wiki/<USER_ID>{code}

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page properties report macro breaks link to mention

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to find the links of all pages while adding page links using the insert link option, only a few page links are searchable.
h3. Environment

Confluence cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Step 1. Go to a page and try to insert a link search for a specific page.
 !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!   !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail! 
Test case:

1. I have below existing pages in my test instance *nghuraiya.atlassian.net*
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

2.I want to link "Test page for line brak" page, but when I search it in insertlink it does not show the expected result.
  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Expected Results

Should be able to add all existing page link.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to insert/search all page links only a few page links are available.
h3. Workaround

To link a page, select a text and use insert link option and open *edit link* to edit page link and update page URL.
fields.summary: Adding a link using the new editor does not find all pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary The hyperlinks on the exported page for old and new editor don't show full site path and reports truncated URLs like "/wiki/spaces/TEST1/overview" in the document. h3. Environment # Confluence Cloud h3. Steps to Reproduce # Highlight the text and click on *Insert link* # Insert page title > click on *Search* # Click on *Insert* # Publish the page # Export the page to *Word*. h3. Expected Results It should create the full path of the site in the exported document h3. Actual Results The initial part of the site doesn't reflect in the URL. h3. Notes: The source code of the document will show something similar to below: {code}

Trying with gibberish content


Word document

https://www.google.com/

test space

{code} h3. Workaround - No available workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have Arabic characters in your page, when exporting as PDF, the Arabic characters becomes blank spaces

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with Arabic character as content
 # Export as PDF
 # Check PDF

h3. Expected Results

* PDF should be similar to the page

h3. Actual Results

* All Arabic character content is missing

h3. Workaround

Export as Word, then use Microsoft Word to export/print as PDF.
fields.summary: Export to PDF does not process Arabic characters

fields.description:
h3. Summary When you insert a link via {{Insert more content > Link > Web link}} or the shortcuts {{⌘+K}} / {{CTRL+K}}, the link is no longer clickable or editable once you save the page. This applies to TinyMCE. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new page and insert a web link via one of the methods below: #* {{Insert more content > Link > Web link}} #* {{⌘+K}} / {{CTRL+K}} # Insert any one of the URLs with the protocols below into the 'Address' field: #* {{file://xxxxx}} (For local file links) #* {{scp://user@ip_address}} # Insert any text into the the 'Link text' field. # Click on "Insert". # Test that the link can be edited by clicking on it. # Save the page. # Test that the link can be clicked on and works. # Click on "Edit" to edit the page again. # You can see that the link is no longer editable because nothing appears when you click on it. # Save the page. h3. Expected Results The link on the page should be clickable. h3. Actual Results The link is not clickable and nothing happens when you click on it. h3. Note This happens because it changes the storage format of the page from: {code}

Test

{code} To: {code}

Test

{code} See linked issue for Confluence Server:https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-46039
fields.summary: Links can't be edited or clicked on after saving the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * CTRL+Z hotkey doesn't work when we input text on Russian, and it starts working if it switches back to English., i.e. the text editor interprets the system hotkey like CTRL+Я

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud
 * Windows Pro

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Add few Russian Text to a confluence page
 * Undo few words using hotkey Ctrl+Z

h3. Expected Results
 * Undo works properly using the shortcut.

h3. Actual Results
* No changes reflected

h3. Workaround

Switchback the layout from Russian to English
fields.summary: Ctrl+Z hot key doesn't work in Russian keyboard layout

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Users cannot see a page when clicking a link generated by [Table of Contents Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/table-of-contents-macro-724765294.html] to headers containing a percent sign ({{%}}).
h3. Environment
 * Fabric
 * TinyMCE

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with a Table of Contents Macro and a header "Header % sample text"
 # Publish the page and click the link of the header
 **  !Screenshot 2019-09-02 11.16.46.png|thumbnail! 
 # Verify the page complaining an error
 ** !Screenshot 2019-09-02 11.09.35.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

You can jump to the clicked header.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the web UI:
{code:none}
Error: malformed URI sequence.
Error info:
    in Connect(ViewPageGraphQL)
    ...
{code}

In the browser console, it shows:

{code:none}
URIError: "malformed URI sequence"
{code}

h3. Notes
The following error message was recently noticed on the new editor:
| !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
After receiving the error, replace '%' with '%25' at the page's URL.
Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: ToC Macro causes a "malformed URI sequence" error with headers containing a percent sign

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a chart macro and provide values following the sample at [Chart Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/chart-macro-724765165.html]
 # Replace the value of "Status" column with a status label
# In the macro setting, set the parameters following the document above and check the preview

h3. Expected Results
Since non-percentage values are not supported, the preview loading fails and the user would be able to know it isn't supported

h3. Actual Results
The preview will be shown with no issues and when the user publishes the page, the macro will be shown as blank

h3. Note
This will happen even if you exclude the "Status" column from the scope of the macro(setting ",,1,2,3" for "Columns".

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using ganttchart in the Chart macro, "Status" macro set in the "Status" column previews properly even though it fails when published

fields.description:
Hi,

According to the documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/office-powerpoint-macro-375849178.html], powerpoint macro has a "slide" parameter that specifies the number of slide to present in a confluence page. I this parameter is available only for a "server edition", but in "cloud edition" it is not supported.

I would like to have a "slide" parameter support in "cloud edition" of the Confluence as well.

Thanks,

Evgeny
fields.summary: Powerpoint macro - ability to present specific slide in presentation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When inserting the [Chart macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/chart-macro-724765165.html] in a template and then, tapping the *Preview* button to see its rendering, the macro will give the following messages depending on which editor you are using:

{quote}
Cannot find page with content id: 0
{quote}

Or, on the new editor:

{quote}
Failed to get macro details
{quote}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, either go to *Global templates and Blueprints* or in a space *Content tools > Templates*.
# Make sure to edit an existing template or create a new one and insert the *Chart* macro to the template.
# Tap the *Preview* button

h3. Expected Results

The preview should render the macro and the details of the chart.

h3. Actual Results
The preview displays one of the following messages:

!template.png|thumbnail!

!details.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

The page is properly created with the template and the chart works fine.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Previewing a template with Chart macros will result on an error where the macro is located

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The link feature (Ctrl+K / Command+K) is not reliably suggesting Pages and Jira tickets, with some of the available options appearing on the results and some of them not.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on the linked space
 # Insert a link (Ctrl+K / Command+K)
 # Start typing a Page's title or Jira Issue Key

h3. Expected Results

It should suggest all corresponding pages and tickets
h3. Actual Results

Sometimes, it doesn't list specific pages or tickets:
|!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!|!screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Workaround

Paste the direct link to the page/ ticket.
fields.summary: Link feature on the new editor doesn't reliably list results

fields.description:
When we create a Software Project space on Confluence, we link this space with a JIRA project.
After the space creation, in the *Space Shortcuts* session (on the sidebar), it is created a link to the JIRA project with the project name - and probably it is the same as the space name if you did not change the space name when creating the space.

However, we do not have any evidence that this is a shortcut to jump to the JIRA project which is linked with this space. This suggestion aims to let this shortcut clarified to the end-user, adding a JIRA icon on this shortcut or some highlighting on it, saying that this is a JIRA link.
fields.summary: Software Project space blueprint: JIRA project shortcut more clear

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The inline comment displays an error "Could not save" on mention macro.

h3. Environment
* Confluence Cloud
* Mention

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create three action items
 # Include mention macro in one of action item

h3. Expected Results
The comment should be saved.

h3. Actual Results
It doesn't and throws an error with status code 500.

h3. Workaround
Escape the text containing mention macro text and you are good with rest text to allow the contents to be saved without any errors.
fields.summary: The inline comment fails to save on Mention macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On macros with filters (page properties report, Content by label), it's not possible to select a custom date
h3. Environment
 * Confluence cloud
 * Legacy/ New editors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and insert the *Page Properties Report* macro
 # Click on *Add a filter* and select *Created*
 # Select *Custom*

h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to select a date from the date picker
h3. Actual Results

The date picker will be under the macro's panel/ dialog:
|!Screen Shot 2019-08-29 at 21.05.29.png|thumbnail!|
h3. Notes

If a date range is typed, the following error wil be shown when previewing the macro and it will not be inserted to the page:
{code:none}
An exception occurred while previewing the macro. Exception: Error migrating macro 'detailssummary' in content 'ContentId{id=2424846}' from schema version 2. Message: Could not parse cql : label = "test" and space = currentSpace() and created >= "08/08/2019" and created <= "09/09/2019" > null > null{code}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: It's not possible to use custom date filter on macros

fields.description:

Reproduced on Chrome and Firefox
On Hello

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page with page comments
# Try to click on a time stamp

h3. Expected Results
It should be clickable and would be able to use this link to point to a comment easily.

h3. Actual Results
The timestamp is only text.

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the application is in a state that *Blank pages* are pointing to the [new editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html] and the user has a *Legacy template* to create pages using the Legacy editor, if the user creates an undefined link in the Legacy page (as it is not available on the new editor), tapping it will open the edit mode of a page using the Legacy editor and the page will timeout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In a Confluence that has the *Blank pages* template pointing to the new editor,  and another template with the *Old editor*, make sure to create a page with the Legacy editor.
# Create an [undefined link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/undefined-page-links-139580.html] and publish the page.
# Tap the undefined link.

h3. Expected Results
The editor should be opened and allow the page to be created.

h3. Actual Results
The link will open a new page in the Legacy editor and it will timeout, as seen the record below:

 [^undefined.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Right-click and open the link in a new tab will make a page with the new editor to be opened and allowed to be created.
fields.summary: Tapping undefined links on a page created with the Legacy editor will fail

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The persona template documentation is not coherent with neither _+Old or New editing experience+_

h3. How to replicate
 # Log in to Confluence
 # Create a new page using templates
 # Select the Persona template

h3. Expected results
The persona template is the same as what is presented in our documentation

h3. Actual results
The page that results from the usage of the Persona Template is not coherent with what is presented in our documentation about the Persona Template itself.

h3. Workaround
Manually insert columns or sections to fix the template.

h3.Suggested resolution
Fix documentation to correctly reflect what the template actually is  

h3. Documentation
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/persona-template-957141206.html]
fields.summary: Persona template documentation inconsistency

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The old editing experience has a feature that allows you to create a link to a website from an image. This feature was removed in the new editor, but if you copy an image with a link and paste it into the new editing experience, once you try to export this page to word, it will generate an error 500.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce

[^How to reproduce the bug.mp4]
h3. Error Message

Check the file name for capitalization or other typing errors.
 Check to see if the file was moved, renamed or deleted.
h3. Expected Results

The page is exported to a Word file.
h3. Actual Results

You are redirected to a "This site can’t be reached" / "File not found" error page
h3. Workaround

Save the image on your computer and delete it from the page. Then, upload the image to the page again.
fields.summary: Export pages to Word on new editor breaks if the image contains a link

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the Page Tree macro on the new editor, the title of the pages will be shown below the bullets

h3. Environment
* New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page tree (parent page and a couple of children pages)
# Insert the Page Tree macro on the parent page and set it to {{@self}} as Root Page
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
The list should be rendered with the pages' titles along with the bullets

h3. The titles are displayed below the bullets:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-08-29 at 16.34.30.png|thumbnail!  |


h3. Workaround
It displays correctly when using the "Expand/Collapse all" option inside the Page Tree macro.
fields.summary: Page Tree macro indentation problem on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After deleting and reactivating Confluence on a cloud site (that also has Jira) old activity remains from the previous Confluence. It's not getting cleared out as expected. Clicking on any of the links results in errors.
h3. Environment

(Optional - If Applicable)
 * Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Use a cloud instance with Jira and Confluence (I have JSW, JSD & Core)
 # Log into Confluence - you're taken through onboarding to create a space and a page. I created 'Test space' and 'Test page'
 # Go to site admin Billing > Manage subscriptions
 # Delete Confluence (select 3 dots and type DELETE, click Other then Delete)
 # Wait 5 minutes
 # Go to site admin Discover applications
 # For Confluence, click Reactivate, click Start trial
 # Close the dialog, don't go to Confluence yet
 # Wait 5 minutes 
 # Go to Confluence
 # The onboarding screens appear but now you get 'Choose a space to work in' and Test space is selected.
 # Leave it selected and click Next.
 # On the Activity page you see Test space and Test page listed (along with a bunch of other stuff like pie.png, etc)
 # If you click the Test page or Test space you get the message 'This page isn't available It belonged to a space that has been deleted or the permissions have changed.' On the left sidebar, it says 'Unknown space' and under PAGES it says 'Page tree failed to load'

h3. Expected Results

I expected Confluence to be cleaned out and like a new instance with no data.
h3. Actual Results

The process of deleting and reactivating Confluence is not clearing out all data from previous instance. I opened case [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/projects/JST/queues/issue/JST-503475] initially because space imports were failing after doing this but I was able to fix that issue but changing the order I did things in. But data is still remaining in Confluence. That's an issue for us in Atlassian University as we will be taking down and restore sites for our cloud training. They need to be clean when we start a new course.
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: After deleting and reactivating Confluence old activity remains

fields.description:
h2. Suggestion Details

Confluence notifies me of changes to a page when it is relocated/moved, but aside from asking the person who moved the page there is no way to know the page was moved.

It would be helpful for this to be recorded in the page history with a default change comment, as well as in any notifications sent when the move is enacted.
h2. Alerts & Notifications
 * Emails
 * Notifications to watchers & contributors

{quote}User Name moved your page

Page Name Link

3hr ago
{quote}
h2. Page History

Suggested Default Change Comment
{quote}Page moved from \{location} to \{location}
{quote}
fields.summary: Record page relocation/move in page history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the application is rolled out to have new pages using the new editor for blank pages, in a specific phase of the migration (or for specific customer scenarios), there will have a template to create pages using the Legacy Editor. When tapping in this template, the new editor is being opened, instead of the Legacy one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have a Confluence application with the *Blank page (old) (going away soon)* template
# Try to create a new page with the '+' icon in the sidebar and then, tap the *Blank page (old) (going away soon)* option

h3. Expected Results
This template should create a page using the Legacy Editor.

h3. Actual Results
The page s created using the new editor.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating a page with the "Blank page (old) (going away soon)" template creates a page using the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we are creating some content on a page and decide to include a bullet/numbered list if in the second bullet/number we press the up arrow keyboard key, instead of the cursor gets in the previous bullet/number, it goes to the content above the list.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* New Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page;
# Insert some text - like Lorem Ipsum stuff;
# After the text, insert at least a bullet/numbered list with two lines;
# From anywhere in the second bullet/numbered option of the list, press the *up* keyboard key.

h3. Expected Results
The cursor goes to the line above from where it is.

h3. Actual Results
The cursor goes directly to the text that is over the bullet/numbered list.

h3. Notes
* It happens the same with the *down* arrow keyboard key: when clicking on it, instead of it place the cursor to the next option in the list, it goes to the content under the list.

h3. Workaround
Instead of using the up arrow key, use the mouse to put the cursor in the option you want.
fields.summary: Up arrow doesn't work correctly in bullet/numbered lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It's no longer possible to change the visible text of the link for user mentions

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a Confluence page, create a user mention and change the visible Link text while still in edit mode.
# After publishing the page, the link text resets to the user profile text but still works.
# The link text is no longer editable in any way after going to edit mode again.

h3. Expected Results
- The custom text added to the user profile will still be visible after published. 

h3. Actual Results
- After publishing the page, the link text resets to the user profile text but still works.
- The link text is no longer editable in any way after going to edit mode again.
 
h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: User mention does not support custom link text & cannot be edited after publishing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a new template with variables and after saving the template it's adding new lines/gap above all the table entries and information panels in the edit mode.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new template, add variables and save the template. 
#  Open the template in edit mode and see that new blank lines are appearing in the 
     information panel macro and in the table entries. 
# Blank lines keep on increasing every time we save the template and goes back to edit 
     mode.

h3. Expected Results: 
It should not show blank lines/space. 
h3. Actual Results: 
It is showing blank lines every time we save and open the template in edit mode. Blank lines keep on increasing every time we save the template and goes back to edit mode.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], if the user uses the [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] in order to retrieve images from an excerpt to a page using the Legacy editor, the images will have its size reduced.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the legacy editor and insert an image with its original size inside an *Excerpt* macro.
# Create a different page using the new editor and include the *Excerpt include* macro on it. Make sure that this macro is pointing to the page created in the step above
# Publish the page and compare the image size between the original page (with the Legacy editor) and the other page (with the new editor) retrieving the content from the Excerpt macro.

h3. Expected Results
The image should respect the size from the original page.

h3. Actual Results
The image is reduced.

h3. Notes
This does not happen between pages only using the new editor.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Using images inside excerpt macros between editor versions will reduce the size of the file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the user [comments on an file|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/share-and-comment-on-files-724765118.html#Shareandcommentonfiles-Commentonafile] in order to trigger a notification, this will be displayed as an action made by an anonymous user, instead of the current user sharing the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page using the Legacy editor.
# Attach a file to the page.
# After publishing the page, tap the file. While on the preview mode, tap the little comment button on the bottom of it.
# Add a new comment (good advice is to mention someone to trigger the notification in their email inbox)

h3. Expected Results
The notification should be displayed as the user who performed it.

h3. Actual Results
The notification displays as done by an anonymous user.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pin/Comments on attachments displaying as anonymous

fields.description:
When using the mobile version to view a confluence document created in the desktop version, lines of text frequently extend beyond the view window. It would be helpful to have an easy view-configuration option to force such lines to wrap based on the size of the current view screen.

Pinch gestures allow the user to zoom in or out, but this often makes the text so small that it is unreadable.

The component selection (below) may be incorrect, but I've been struggling for several minutes trying to get the pull-down list to display properly on my phone, and I don't want to waste more time.
fields.summary: Add easily accessible word wrap option to Mobile app

fields.description:
At the moment, the macros show only the option to change the width of the charts. You can refer the attached screenshot. However, it would be nice to have the option to change the height because the details of the chart are truncated and not readable. A workaround would be add an element:
Examples: "300" (300px), "300px", "50%", "auto"
fields.summary: Ability to adjust the height for Time Since Chart and Created vs Resolved Chart Macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When typing in the new fabric editor, there's a lag when there's a lot of new lines (like 100) or the characters exceed 3000.

h3. Environment
Confluence cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page with a lot of contents. Like 3k plus characters
# Start typing at the end

h3. Expected Results
The typing should be smooth

h3. Actual Results
There's a consistent lag when typing

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Fabric editor lags when typing

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We are receiving feedback from some users on our cloud site that it is difficult to search and that this is in part due to the number of search results that are returned. We are wondering if there's a way to automatically limit search results to include only pages. As an example, you can see that a search for a word also returns an image file, draw.io diagrams and other kinds of files.

I have reviewed your help pages and I understand how filters can be used on a page of search results. And I understand the use of AND/OR parameters in the search content, but these are additional steps for our users.

h3. Suggestion
Include internal controls where admins could configure which results will be displayed for customers, like a filter for pages.

h3. Workarounds
None
fields.summary: Add internal controls for Confluence Search- Filter by Page

fields.description: Have numerous excerpt include macro's on the new editor, and they fail to display emoji. Specifically check marks and cross's
fields.summary: Excerpt Include macro doesn't correctly display emoji

fields.description:
The new editor roll-out has removed the left menu - in the interests of removing distractions, or something like that. Well that decision is at the expense of functionality. Previously, if I was editing content and wanted to browse other content (eg. to inform me in my process of writing content on the page presently being edited), I could right-click any page in my space hierarchy and open in a new tab. Gone. Now I would have to save or cancel my changes, wait for the page to re-load, wait for the hierarchy to build, then open in a new tab and then go back and start editing again, or I would have to right-click a breadcrumb node (the only navigation left while editing), open that in a new window, wait for that to load, wait for the hierarchy to load, then find the page I actually want to read (which might not have been in that breadcrumb trail) and open that page, wait for it to load, and then read my content.

 

If that was verbose and boring, it was on purpose - to emphasise how this "improvement" has impacted productivity.

 

At the very least, allow the page hierarchy (left menu) to pop up if I hover over the left edge of the screen - that way you get your perceived benefit of a clutter-free working environment, and I don't get lost functionality that is valuable to me.
fields.summary: Display the left menu while editing documents

fields.description:
{panel:title= Bug Fix Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
(i)
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for the fix to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes bugfixes.
 You can learn more by reading [Atlassian Cloud Bug Fixing Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/atlassian-cloud-bug-fixing-policy-206865884.html].
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Users see blank page when browsing a page history if they don't have access to the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access to a page history by the user who doesn't have access to the page

!Screenshot 2019-08-28 10.30.20.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

Users see *This is a restricted space* if they don't have access to the page.
h3. Actual Results

We see an error like below in the browser console:
{code:none}
TypeError: Cannot read property 'spaceKey' of null
    at n.value (ViewPageRedirectComponent.js:63)
    ...
{code}
Redirection stops at somewhere like [https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SE/history/15040513?ccProxyTarget=ATL-Confluence-Shard-V2&ccProxyStaticApp=true|https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SE/history/15040513?ccProxyTarget=ATL-Confluence-Shard-V2&ccProxyStaticApp=true].
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Blank history page shown to users having no access to the page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the new editing experience, if the user creates an action item and puts a bullet point below it, the "delete/fn+delete" key will create an extra action item bellow the bullet point, instead of deleting the content inside it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the new editing experience, make sure to create a new page.
 # In this page, create an action item and put a text inside it.
 # Insert a bullet point below the action item
 # Come back to the action item and at the end of it, use the fn+delete for Mac or the delete key for Windows in order to bring the bullet point to the line above.

h3. Expected Results

The bullet point content should come to the action item.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence creates a new action item below the bullet point.

h3.Notes
Attached a video of the behavior:
 [^delete.mp4]  

h3. Workaround

No workaround besides manually copying and pasting the content from the bullet point into the action item.
fields.summary: Using the delete key in an action item with bullet points below it will create a new action item

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when the application has the new editor rolled out for existing pages, on the next time that the user edits a Legacy editor page, it will open the page with the new editor with the content already converted.

When using tools to work with screenshots and crop a specific part of the image in order to paste into the Legacy editor pages, when the conversion happens, the images that previously were only displaying the cropped content will display a blank margin as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to create a new page using the Legacy Editor, prior to having the editor conversion in the site.
# Take a screenshot or an existing picture and open in the image editor for your OS (in this case, the bundled image editor from MAC OSX has been used and other tools like Snagit can also help on reproducing the issue)
# Select a specific part of the image and use a CMD+C in order to copy only the selected part. Paste it into the Legacy editor page while editing it.
# Publish the page.
# Have the instance converted to the new editor.
# Edit the page in order to trigger the new editor on it.

h3. Expected Results
The image should have the same properties and look as it was in the Legacy editor. As an example, like the image below:
!example1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
The same image will have blank margins around it, where it did not have previously. The borders also do not seem to be matching what would be considered the whole image/screenshot that was cropped:
!example2.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
* This happens with any image that is cropped. A screenshot of an existing image.
* If the user simply copies the image with blank margins (with a CMD+C) and paste on the same page while being edited, the image will be pasted without the borders.
* On the first time editing the page, the image will have different size as well.


h3. Workaround

Copy and paste the image with the blank margins.
fields.summary: The conversion between editors adds a blank margin to cropped images

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], if the user uses the [Excerpt Include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] in order to retrieve content from a different page, if the included page has custom emojis, those will be converted into text-only (showing the name instead of the image).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to create custom emojis by going to an existing page and tapping *Emojis > +/create your own emoji*.
# After having the emoji created, create a page and insert the *Excerpt* macro. Inside the macro, make sure to add the newly created custom emoji.
# Publish the page
# Create a new page and insert the *Excerpt Include* macro in order to retrieve the page above.
# Check the emojis inside the macro.

h3. Expected Results
The custom emoji should display the image for its creation, like the following:
!custom.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
Only the name of the emoji is displayed in text:
!text.png|thumbnail!
 
h3.Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Retrieving pages with custom emojis with the Excerpt Include macro turns them into text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the [new editing experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], if the user uses the [Include page macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/include-page-macro-724765214.html] in order to retrieve content from a different page, if the included page has emojis, those will be converted into the blue star emoji.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with any emojis (custom or default ones)
# Create a different page and insert the *Include page* macro in order to retrieve the created page above.
# Publish the page and check the content inside the macro.

h3. Expected Results
The page should retrieve the same emojis. Using the test below, it should be like the following:

!default.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results
Instead, the emojis will be converted into the blue star one:
!include.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Retrieving pages with emojis with the Include Page macro turns them into blue star emojis

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, in order to make a page open for anonymous/public, the user needs to open the whole space for anonymous user and restrict all other pages which should not be accessed by the anonymous user.

If the user has 150 pages on the space and only want 30 pages to be open for the public, it will be a challenge.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting a full URL for a Blog Page into the editor does not create a correct link.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Blog Page
# Create a regular page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating content property keys with dashes thru {{AP.confluence.setContentProperty()}} are saved as underscores thus accessing through CQL (content.property[my-content-property]) would fail.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new content property key with dashes in the string (eg "my-content-property").
# Use AP.confluence.setContentProperty() to insert a new content property value.
# Get content and expand properties: /wiki/rest/api/content/{id}?expand=metadata.properties
# You'll see that the key has been saved as "my_content_property".
# Any attempt to access that content property using the original key name with dashes will fail (eg via CQL content.property[my-content-property]).

h3. Expected Results
Properties are saved as is

h3. Actual Results
Properties are converted from "-" to "_"

h3. Notes
* Would be great if doco is updated to accomodate this behavior or don't convert dashes
h3. Workaround
* Replace "-" with "_" on CQL search
fields.summary: Content property keys: dashes save as underscores
Context parameter to tell apps which mode the user is in
Placeholder for the macro fails to render with null pointer exception

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the legacy editor, the sidebar will be displayed over the file previewer (images, documents).

h3. Environment
 * Legacy (old) editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with the legacy editor
# Attach an image and publish the page
# Click on the image

h3. Expected Results
The file viewer should cover the entire page

h3. Actual Results
The file viewer is kept under the sidebar:
|  !Screen Shot 2019-08-26 at 21.29.15.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

{panel}

h3. Description

With the [new editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], the layouts have changed in order to provide different options for the users in order to be aligned with the newly introduced modifications and how the pages will render in terms of user experience.

However, there are missing options in which were usable in terms of organization and to quickly help users reorganizing them, instead of relying on copy and paste from one specific part to the other. Those options would be:

* Single column layout: No longer available and the closest of it would be to use a default space outside of the sections/columns. This could be useful for users that quickly wanted to reach certain parts of the page, or, copy only the content inside the specific column/section.
* Options to Move to top/bottom: To quickly insert a new section above the page location. For larger pages, this quickly helped users to insert new content into a specific part and if needed, quickly re-organize a hierarchy of content that could be also used in macros like Table of Contents.

This is a request to have options to Move the layouts to the top/bottom back and also, the single-column layout for organization purposes.
fields.summary: Additional options for page layouts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, the user can use the [Excerpt include macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-include-macro-724765190.html] in order to include an [excerpt from a different page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/excerpt-macro-724765191.html]. 

In the [new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], if the user uses an Excerpt Include macro to retrieve an Excerpt from a page with a table using the Legacy Editor, the table will lose the bold formatting for the fonts in the header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a page created with the Legacy editor.
# In this page, include an *Excerpt macro* with a table inside it. Put some text on the table header.
# Have a page created with the new editor.
# In this page, add the *Excerpt Include* macro and configure it to retrieve the created excerpt from the page with the legacy editor.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
The formatting on the table header should remain the same.

h3. Actual Results
The table header loses the bold formatting.

h3. Notes
* This does not happen if the excerpt is retrieved from the new editor into the Legacy one.
* This does not happen between pages using the new editor.

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

If possible, create a copy of the page with the Legacy Editor using the new editor template.
fields.summary: Table loses bold formatting on headers when included from excerpts between editor versions

fields.description:
It will be great to have an easy (automated) way of importing all the data from Podio into Confluence.

Users can try this Chrome extension [https://itemexporter.com|https://itemexporter.com/] to export data from Podio to word, and then use the word import option, but this is not feasible if one has have multiple KB already stored in Podio as this can be achived only manually.
fields.summary: Import items from Podio into Confluence

fields.description:
It's common to identify gaps that need to be addressed in an information store by recording and reviewing the search terms which come up with NO RESULTS.

Example: if I search on "vacation policy" and nothing comes up on the corporate Confluence wiki, then either we're using the wrong terms/labels if the article exists OR we need to create a page to help colleagues find information about our vacation policy.

I don't think of this as an Add-on but a core report.

 

[https://www.uxbooth.com/articles/design-no-results-found-pages-that-get-results/]

https://www.nngroup.com/articles/search-no-results-serp/
fields.summary: Report on search terms which have no results in Confluence Cloud

fields.description:
If I want to create a page on the mobile app for confluence cloud (ios) it will always create that page in my private space in the main hierarchy. I found out that i can change the location, but it is not very intuitive. Much better would be, *if I create this page under the page I browsed in the "Spaces" Tab.* This is where I always want my pages and I expected this behaviour, because the cloud Confluence has that behaviour.

I know that this would not be completely ideal as you can create new pages in "Your Work", "Activity" and "Notifications", but this would be much faster for the creation process.

Much better would be, if the Page would be shown in the overview when creating the page with a direkt click link to changing the location.

When I include an image on a Confluence page and the sidebar is open (expanded), the full-size image rests underneath the sidebar. It does not stay contained in the frame. A user has to collapse the sidebar to view the image as a whole.

This wasn't like this about a month ago. Please fix. Thanks.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Keyboard shortcuts work based on the English (United States) keyboard layout in Windows. Languages such as Russian or Arabic (different characters by default) conflict with the shortcuts and they do not work.

h3. Suggested Solution
Keep shortcuts bound to the specific key that is being pressed instead of the actual character sent by the key press. 

h3.  Workaround
Change keyboard layout to American English
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts do not work in some keyboard layouts in Windows

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the [new editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], in order to publish a page edit without notifying the watchers of the page/space, the user must tap the *ellipsis* button and then, select the *Publish without notifying watchers* button. 

This option is not working and even if the user selects this option, this will notify the watchers of the space/page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to access an existing page and then, edit it.
# On this page, as an administrator of the space, make sure to add people to become watchers of the page/space by using the little eye icon (on the top right, which is the *watch* icon) and then, tap *Manage Watchers* to add the user(s)
# Make a small edit on the page, and then, tap the ellipsis button on the top right of the *Close* button and then, select *Publish without notifying watchers*.

h3. Expected Results
The page should be published without notifying watchers.

h3. Actual Results
The email notification is sent a couple of minutes after having the edit performed. 

h3. Notes
This does not seem to affect the Legacy Editor.

h3. Workaround
Either restrict the page for the user that will publish it, when publishing it, or, remove the watchers before publishing it.
fields.summary: Publish without notifying watchers notifies the watchers

fields.description:

With the [new editing improvements|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html], when a user inserts an image inside the column macro (or a table), the same will lose the alignment options, leading the user to only be able to resize it inside it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to create a new page using the new editor.
# In the page, insert a column macro and then, upload an image inside of it
# Tap the image in order to see its current options.

h3. Expected Results
The alignment options should be displayed, as it would in any other normal part of the page.

h3. Actual Results
No options besides the remove or resize ones are displayed.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Images inside column macro will lose the alignment options

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add any user in the restricted permissions on a page, if it has a deleted group in the list, after you hit apply to save changes, you receive a error message:

"There was an error submitting the page restrictions. Please try again later."

It happens regardless of having full permissions in the space, space admin or site-Admin rights.

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a group and add it to a restricted page
 # Delete the group created
 # Add a user to the restricted page

h3. Expected Results

Able to add user in the restriction page list
h3. Actual Results

Not able to add user to the restrictions page list.
h3. Workaround

Remove the deleted group from the restriction's page list, will able to add users as expected.
fields.summary: Trying to add users with a deleted group in a restricted page list  returns an error
Space Imports are failing with "Transaction rolled back because it is marked as rollback only."

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we add a link/hyperlink on a page that directs the user to comment on that page, instead of the user get on the comment, the comment just gets highlighted on the page - a second click is needed if you want to jump to the comment.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Pages in both editors

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page with a few paragraphs (with [Lorem Ipsum|https://www.lipsum.com/feed/html] stuff)
# Publish the page;
# Add a comment;
# In the comment, right-click over time the comment was inserted (if you just added this comment, it should be like "_less than a minute ago_"), and copy its link;
# Edit the page
# Insert the comment link and publish the page;
# Click on the link.

h3. Expected Results
The browser scrolls down until your comment.

h3. Actual Results
The comment is just highlighted, so you must to manually scroll down your browser until the comment.

h3. Workaround
Double-click over the comment link.
fields.summary: Clicking on a link to a comment just highlight the comment instead of jump you to the comment

Confluence cloud

h3. Problem Definition

On the legacy editor, if we pasted a link to a video (e.g. youtube), the link would be automatically converted into a widget connector, which would display the video.

This feature is not available on the new editor.
h3. Suggested Solution

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On the legacy editor, if an issue key was typed to the page, it was automatically converted to a link to the issue upon publishing the page (on a Confluence space linked to a Jira project).

This feature is not available on the new editor.

h3. Suggested Solution
Bring this functionality to the new editor.

h3. Workaround
Copy the link to the issue and insert it on the page.
fields.summary: Automatically link jira issues on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, the user can configure an Application Links to a Jira instance from a different site URL in order to display content from Jira inside macros like the *Jira issues* one. Once the link is configured, in order to add a Jira issue macro from the different site, the user will need to tap the *Login & Approve* button in order to authenticate and *Allow* the Oauth token to be created.

If a different user that has not authenticated yet tries to see the page with the Jira issue macro from a different instance, it will keep spinning until it eventually displays a message that there was an error retrieving the Jira issues macro, instead of asking the same to authenticate in order to see it. This can cause confusion as the user believes that an error might have happened, instead of needing to either create new Jira issues macro in a page, or, edit an existing one in order to use the *Login & Approve* button.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have Jira and Confluence from two different sites (e.g. jira.atlassian.net and confluence.atlassian.net).
# As an administrator of both instances, from Confluence go to *Settings > Application Links* and create a new application link pointing to the Jira instance.
# After having it created, access a page and insert the *Jira issues* macro and point it to correct Jira instance.
# Tap the *Login & Approve* button in order to use a valid JQL and find issues to be inserted from the target Jira instance.
# Ask for a different user (with access to Jira and Confluence) to access the page and check the Jira issues macro.

h3. Expected Results
The macro should be displaying an error pointing that the user must authenticate in order to see the content.

h3. Actual Results
The macro keeps spinning (Getting issue details) and eventually has an error that the content could not be displayed.

h3. Notes

To see the issue, the user must either:

# Create a new Jira issue macro in order to retrieve the *Login & Approve* link to authenticate.
# Or edit the Jira issue macro with issues and the *Login & Approve* button will be displayed

Ideally, the pop-up should have the option to *Login & Approve* in order to see the Jira issues macro, or, creating an application link should also create the impersonation (optionally, as it used to happen with the deprecated "Oauth impersonation" authentication for application links) method for existing users in Jira and Confluence.

h3. Workaround
No workaround besides having the user authenticating to see the Jira issues macro after a couple of minutes.
fields.summary: Misleading message for Jira issues macro from a different instance

fields.description:
!Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 16.28.01.png|thumbnail! h3. Issue Summary
When inserting a link to another page on the new editor, this link won't be editable
 
h3. Environment
* New editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Copy the link to a page
# Create a new page and insert the link
# The link will be changed into the page's title
# Try to edit that link

h3. Expected Results
It should be possible to edit that link, the same way it was on the legacy editor
|  !Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 16.28.01.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Actual Results
There's no option to edit it
|  !Screen Shot 2019-08-22 at 16.28.15.png|thumbnail!  |

h3. Workaround
Either:
* Press Ctrl+Z or Command+Z after pasting the link to revert it to a normal link

OR

* Use Ctrl+K or Command+K to insert the link, as it won't change into the page's title this way
fields.summary: It's not possible to edit links to pages on the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When trying to add an *Expand* macro to a page it is not possible to edit it or add content in the macro. It is also a problem when expanding the *Expand* macro on a published page, as it breaks the page throwing a front-end error.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * New editing experience
 * Internet Explorer 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using a different browser;
 # Add an expand macro and write some text on it;
 # Publish the page;
 # Expand the *Expand macro*.

h3. Expected Results

The content inside the Expand macro is shown.
h3. Actual Results

Confluence shows a front-end error

!image-2019-08-22-15-55-55-723.png|width=516,height=426!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
New pages have a simpler looking set of options, the functionality is more dispersed around the page. For example table options like row management are in the table.  Older pages have a more extensive command/option ribbon.

The challenge comes in when ramping up a less experienced user set that is confused by the changing options that appear to be random.

PLEASE take into account how to provide a consistent environment to work in.
fields.summary: Editor options change based on age of page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attaching a file to a page, it is possible to see a thumbnail of the page in the published version. This thumbnail contains two options: *Document* and *Edit file*.
The *Edit file* option should open the Companion app, but instead, it just downloads the file.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old editing experience
* Firefox and Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an editable file to a page;
# Publish it;
# Click over the *Edit file* option.

h3. Expected Results
The Companion app works and opens the application to edit the file.

h3. Actual Results
The file just downloads

h3. Workaround
Instead of clicking on the *Edit file* button, click on the *Document*. This will opens the file preview. 
From that, click over the *Edit with* and chose the application you want.
fields.summary: Clicking over *Edit file* on an attachment thumbnail just downloads the file

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the *Attachments* macro, you have the option to *view* and *edit* the file (with the Companion App) after expanding the file options. However, clicking over these buttons makes Confluence get stuck on a spinning wheel.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Both editing experiences
* Firefox and Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach an editable file to a page;
# Add the Attachments macro
# Publish the page;
# Expand the file options and click over the *view* or *edit* options.

h3. Expected Results
*View*: the file preview opens.
*Edit*: Confluence calls the Companion app to edit the file.

h3. Actual Results
Both options get stuck on a spinning wheel.

h3. Notes
On Google Chrome it works fine.

h3. Workaround
Use Google Chrome.
fields.summary: Attachments macro: view and edit options don't work on Firefox and Safari

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In the code macro settings, you can choose which theme you want to use, but it's not possible to choose a theme you created or to format your own colors.

h4. Solution
Add the ability in *Configure Code Macro* for the administrator to set new themes and choose which one to use for the instance.
fields.summary: Ability to format colors or create own theme for code macro

fields.description:
h4. Summary
In Confluence editor, it's not possible to align the page title. For example, if you want all of your page to be aligned to the left, it is not possible to include the title in this.

h4. Suggestion
To create a way to align page titles in the new editor.
fields.summary: Ability to align the page title

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence Cloud, when you paste an external link (such as Github) into Confluence Cloud (New Editor), it converts to the automatic preview, and then you get the following error:

 !github.png|thumbnail! 

bq. Connect your account to preview links

If you click to connect, you are taken to a page in Github to confirm.

 !Screenshot_2019-08-22_at_10_48_03.png|thumbnail! 

Once you connect, you return back to the page in Confluence, but the error has not gone away.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page in Confluence using the new editor.
# Paste a link to Github, confirm that it converts to automatic preview. Save the page.
# On the page, click the warning to connect your account. Connect your account.
# You are returned to this page, but the warning hasn't changed.

h3. Expected Results
You should now have connected Github to your account and no longer receive the warning.

h3. Actual Results
The warning hasn't changed.

h3. Notes
* Is there no option for a preview without having to connect your account? Some users want to be able to link to a Github account w/o having to link their acccount.
* This also affects links to other applications such as Google Drive.

h3. Workaround
Create a text link instead. 

# Type the text you want to use to link to Github.
# Select the text.
# CMD + K or CTRL + K to bring up the link dialogue. 
# Paste your link.
fields.summary: Connect your account to preview links error on External links

fields.description:
After creating a new template, it's not clear how to actually use the template.

 
h3. Suggestion 1 - One time popup dialog

Would be great to have some instructional dialog pop-up after the first time you edit or create a template telling you to look for it in the page creation dialog.

 
h3. Suggestion 2 - Create page link / button

Would also be great to have a button to create a page from the Space Settings view.

!image-2019-08-21-14-14-04-622.png!
fields.summary: Help user with creating pages using newly-created template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when exporting a page to PDF, if the page contains different Jira issues macros and the user uses the *Table* option for displaying them, the icon for the priority (P) and Issue Type, will not be displayed on the same.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence
 # In the page, make sure to add a new Jira issue to the page
 # On the Jira issue, make sure to tap *Edit* and for the *Display options*, use the *Table* mode. This option must have the *Priority* and *Issue Type* part.
 # Publish the page
 # Export it to PDF

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issues macro should have the icon for the priority.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Exporting pages with Jira issues does not include the icon for priority and  issue type

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the old editor, while editing a table, the users were able to copy/cut/paste rows and columns by clicking on the buttons available.

In the new editor, there are no buttons for these actions and the only way to copy/cut/paste the rows and columns is by using keyboard shortcuts.

Please see the attachments for reference: the screenshot for the new editor and the recording for the old editor. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the same buttons/functionality to the new editor.
h3. Workaround

Use the cmd/ctrl+c/x/v commands from keyboard.
fields.summary: Enable copy/paste buttons for tables in the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to access a restricted space from a public instance without being logged in, user will receive a *This is a restricted space* as expected but, after they login, they receive a *Oops, you've made a malformed request* 
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 14.55.52.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-08-21 at 14.56.00.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Try to access a restricted space from a public instance without logged in
# Receive a *This is a restricted space* message
# Do you login from this same screen
# Receive the *Oops, you've made a malformed request* message

h3. Workaround
Do your log in before you try to access the restricted space/page.
fields.summary: "Oops, you've made a malformed request" while accessing a restricted space in a public instance

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Excel macro cannot be inserted when page uses new/TWP editor via Safari. Works fine in Chrome and Firefox.

h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Safari and go to a Confluence site
 # Create a blank page (which will likely use the new/TWP editor)
 # Try to insert Excel macro

h3. Expected Results
The macro can be inserted:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-21 at 16.41.57.png|thumbnail! 
Screenshot is using chrome

h3. Actual Results
The macro seems to be loading indefinitely:
 !Screenshot 2019-08-21 at 16.31.56.png|thumbnail! 
Screenshot is using Safari

h3. Workaround

Use a different browser than Safari.
fields.summary: Cannot insert Excel Macro in TWP Editor via Safari

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
To export a Confluence Page in any other language like Cyrillic etc, we need custom fonts to be installed in the Cloud Instance which supports .*ttf* or .*ttc* file (For Font Collections). Now, after installing .ttc files, PDF page export results in Blank Page. 
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install Custom .ttc file
* Export the page with Cyrillic characters

h3. Expected Results
* Page Exported Successfully with the font collections (Italic, Bold)

h3. Actual Results

* Blank Page is exported

h3. Notes

Some times Arial.ttf or Americantyrpewritter.ttc work, but not all fonts are exported.

h3. Workaround

Use .TTF file instead of .TTC to export other language pages
fields.summary: .TTC file not working properly during PDF Export

fields.description: Can you add a feature drop cap to confluence?
fields.summary: Drop cap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Not able to attach an attachment to the page from attachment page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page
# Go to the attachments page
# Upload attachment
# Go back to the actual page
# Edit the page
# Click on "files & images" add a file

h3. Expected Results

The attachments of that page are listed and available for selection.



h3. Actual Results

The attachment uploaded in the attachment page is not available.



h3. Workaround

Upload the attachment to page directly.
fields.summary: Not able to attach attachment from attachment page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Linked spaces are not appearing as expected
* Link labels on spaces are not present and the full URL is displayed instead of the space name
* The link labels display correctly for page links

||Desktop view||Mobile View||
| !Screenshot 2019-08-20 at 23.08.21.png|thumbnail! | !Screenshot_2019-08-20-23-08-40.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a desktop browser, [create a link to a page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/insert-links-and-anchors-724764900.html#InsertLinksandAnchors-Linktoapage] and then create a link to a space
# Publish changes
 # Open the same page on the Android mobile app

h3. Expected Results
* The link label appears correctly and the space name is displayed on the link

h3. Actual Results
* The full URL is displayed

h3. Notes
* Copy/pasted links appear fine in the Android app
* Page links are not affected by this issue
* All links are clickable, so not the same as [CONFCLOUD-62696|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-62696]

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud mobile Android app: Space links are not displayed correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Internet Explorer 11, the calendars don't load at all, as well as the events. Only a blank calendar is being rendered.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud
 * Internet Explorer 11 (Windows)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # From the sidebar, click on *Calendar*

h3. Expected Results

Your calendar's app is loaded, showing the existing calendars and events.
 !image-2019-08-20-15-50-41-883.png|width=255,height=205,thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

A blank calendar is shown, and nothing more.

!image-2019-08-20-15-50-41-883.png|width=427,height=346!
h3. Workaround

Use a different browser
fields.summary: Team Calendars is not loading calendars or events when using IE11

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Confluence, when working with the function to *export to PDF*, the content of the page will be exported and will have a PDF version to be downloaded by the user. However, when the user inserts images to the page and tries to export them, the images will be blurred if they do not have their *Original* size value.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and make sure to have one or more images added to it.
# Make sure to manually reduce the size of the images. On the Legacy Editor, try to select a minor size in the properties of the image, or, manually reduce it. On the new editor, simply drag the vertical bars to make them small.
# Publish the page with the images added to it.
# Once the page is published, tap the ellipsis button on the right side of the page and then, select *Export to PDF*

h3. Expected Results
The image should be export as the same on the page.

h3. Actual Results
The reduced images become blurred/grainy.

h3. Workaround

Use the *Original* size of the image, or, manually increase its size.
fields.summary: Exporting to PDF results in blurred images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to comment on the attachment images, the "pin" icon at the bottom of the page/image is missing in the new editor.
h3. Environment

Confluence Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Open a page in the new editor and upload an image and publish the page.
 # Step 2.Open the page in the preview mode and click on the attached image,at the bottom of image it shows *Zoom out* , *Zoom in*  but it doesn’t show *Fit to page* , *Start presenting,* *Drag this pin to add comments option*

h3. Expected Results: *Drag this pin to add comments option* ,*Fit to page* , *Start presenting*, should be available in the new editor.
h3. Actual Results: *Drag this pin to add comments option* ,*Fit to page* , *Start presenting,* are not available in the new editor.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to Add Attachment/image Comments in new editor
